entries.title: Biden and Pelosi Pay Homage to Benedict XVI
entries.description: President Biden and House Speaker Nancy Pelosi, both Catholic, issued statements mourning the passing of the retired pope.

entries.title: What We Know About the Funeral Arrangements for Pope Benedict XVI
entries.description: About 30,000 were expected to visit St. Peter’s Basilica on each of the three days that the pope emeritus’s body would lie in wake there.

entries.title: With Benedict’s Death, an Unprecedented Moment for the Modern Church
entries.description: Benedict stunned the Roman Catholic world by becoming the first pope in nearly 600 years to resign. Now his death leaves a living pope presiding over the funeral of his predecessor.

entries.title: India Emerges as Key Global Player Amid Russia’s War in Ukraine
entries.description: The invasion of Ukraine, compounding the effects of the pandemic, has contributed to the ascent of a giant that defies easy alignment. It could be the decisive force in a changing global system.

entries.title: Pope Benedict XVI Leaves a Spotty Legacy With Sex Abuse Scandal
entries.description: His efforts to rid the church of what he called “filth” went further than those of John Paul II, but he was reluctant to hold bishops accountable.

entries.title: Why Pope Benedict XVI Resigned In 2013
entries.description: The resignation of Pope Benedict XVI was the first resignation of a pope in six centuries.

entries.title: With Leadership and Speaking Skills, Zelensky Shapes Narrative of the War
entries.description: In nightly addresses to his people and passionate speeches to foreign leaders, the Ukrainian president has delivered a story line to rally his country, and its allies, to Ukraine’s cause.

entries.title: American conservative Catholics mourn Benedict as an unofficial figurehead.
Mixed Emotions in Germany at Benedict XVI’s Death
entries.description: He was the first German pope in over 400 years, but his legacy is marred by failures at handling sexual abuse scandals when he served in southern Germany.

entries.title: Your Best Advice of 2022
entries.description: From readers of The Morning.

entries.title: A Bittersweet First Year for Germany’s New Chancellor
entries.description: Olaf Scholz came to power with a mandate for domestic renewal. Instead, he was forced to upend his country’s traditional stance on war and foreign policy.

entries.title: Reporting Vignettes From the Past Year in Canada
entries.description: The Times’s journalists in Canada reflect on some of the stories and reporting experiences that marked 2022.

entries.title: Long before he was pope, the man who became Benedict was a central figure in the church.
Pope Benedict’s Life in Pictures
entries.description: Here are a selection of images from Benedict’s long life.

entries.title: Updates: Pope Benedict XVI Dies
entries.description: The German pope, formerly Cardinal Joseph Ratzinger, was elected in 2005 as a doctrinal conservative, but stunned the world by resigning in 2013 — the first to do so in centuries.

entries.title: Victor Hugo Statue Takes a Prominent Place in France’s Debate on Race
entries.description: After a restoration darkened the hue of a statue at the birthplace of the French writer, complaints ensued — then vandalism.

entries.title: Clergymen or Spies? Churches Become Tools of War in Ukraine
entries.description: Ukrainian officials are cracking down on a branch of the Russian Orthodox Church that they describe as a subversive force doing the Kremlin’s bidding.

entries.title: For Palestinians, a Rush to Claim ‘Martyrs’ Killed by Israel
entries.description: In one of the deadliest years for Palestinians, a tradition of political and armed groups claiming Palestinian “martyrs” clouds the distinction between civilian and fighter.

entries.title: Benedict XVI, First Modern Pope to Resign, Dies at 95
entries.description: He defined a conservative course for the Roman Catholic Church, but his papacy was noted for his struggle with the clergy sexual abuse scandal and for his unexpected resignation.

entries.title: Benedict: Pope for a Church in Crisis
entries.description: Ian Fisher, The Times's Rome bureau chief from 2004 to 2008, covered Pope Benedict XVI and remembers him as a brilliant theologian who led the Catholic Church through rough times.

entries.title: Zelensky and Putin to Share New Year’s Messages With War Grinding On
entries.description: Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine and Vladimir V. Putin of Russia are expected to address their nations as the first anniversary of Russia’s invasion approaches.

entries.title: Zelensky Signs Controversial News Media Regulation
entries.description: Lawmakers who passed the bill said it would help meet European Union conditions for membership, but journalists have denounced it as a move toward censorship.

entries.title: Zelensky and Putin Set to Address Their Nations
entries.description: Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine and Vladimir V. Putin of Russia will share their New Year’s messages as the war grinds on toward its one-year anniversary.

entries.title: Zelensky and Putin Set to Address Their Nations With No End to War In Sight
entries.description: Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine and Vladimir V. Putin of Russia will share their New Year’s messages as the war grinds on toward its one-year anniversary.
